content.description:
Nescio an ullum iucundiusiucundus, -a, -um, adj.: pleasant tempus exegerim, quam 
quo nupernuper, adv.: recently apud SpurinnamSpurinna, -ae, f.: Spurinna (a Roman male name) fui.
content.question: How is the sentence translated?

choices.label: I don’t know if any more time was pleasantly spent than being with that man Spurinna recently.
I don’t know if any time will be spent more pleasantly than when I was recently with Spurinna.
I don’t know if I have spent any time more pleasantly than when I recently was with Spurinna.
I don’t know if anyone spends time more pleasantly than he who was recently at the house of Spurinna.

content.answer: I don’t know if I have spent any time more pleasantly than when I recently was with Spurinna.

unit.text: 3: Pliny's Letters: Ghosts and Apparitions, Letters to Trajan and Calpurnia, and Teacher's Choice - Latin Prose
